case_vignette: a 65-year-old man of middle eastern descent presents with a tender, weeping mass on his right palm. since appearing 8 months ago, the lesion has enlarged into a 0.9-cm, pink pedunculated nodule with abundant serous crust. the patient has no significant history of trauma. his medical history is significant for atrial fibrillation, hypertension, coronary artery disease, congestive heart failure, and lung cancer, which was treated with right lobectomy. it is unclear what medications were used to treat his lung cancer. his current medications include metoprolol, lisinopril, allopurinol, aspirin, and digoxin. the patient also presents with additional pink, scaly plaques on his right ankle, consistent with nummular eczema.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a tender, weeping mass on my right palm and additional pink, scaly plaques on my right ankle.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
The mass on my right palm appeared 8 months ago.
Have you had any fever, joint pain, or other systemic symptoms?
No, I have not experienced any fever, joint pain, or other systemic symptoms.
Do you have a personal or family history of psoriasis or other skin conditions?
No, I do not have a personal or family history of psoriasis or other skin conditions.
Have you used any new products, come into contact with unusual substances, or started new medications recently?
No, I have not used any new products, come into contact with unusual substances, or started new medications recently.
Is the mass on your palm growing or changing in appearance?
Yes, the mass on my palm has enlarged since it first appeared.
Have you had similar issues in the past or is this the first occurrence?
This is the first occurrence of such an issue.
Final Diagnosis: Palmoplantar keratoderma
